elements.content: SAM supports 6 different AI providers with multiple models each. Choose the provider and model that best fits your needs!

children.content: **GPT-4 Turbo**: Most capable model, excellent for complex tasks (8k-128k context)
**GPT-3.5 Turbo**: Fast and cost-effective for simpler tasks (4k-16k context)
**O1/O3 Series**: Advanced reasoning models for complex problem-solving
**Setup**: Add your OpenAI API key in Preferences > API Providers
Best for: General-purpose AI, coding, analysis, creative writing
**GPT-4**: Access GPT-4 through your Copilot subscription
**Claude 3.5 Sonnet**: Access Anthropic's models through Copilot
**O1 Series**: Advanced reasoning through Copilot
**Setup**: Uses your GitHub Copilot subscription - requires authentication
Best for: Developers with Copilot access who want multiple models
**Claude 3.5 Sonnet**: Excellent reasoning and coding (90k context)
**Claude 4**: Latest generation with improved capabilities (200k context)
**Claude 4.5 Sonnet**: Enhanced performance and accuracy (200k context)
**Setup**: Add your Anthropic API key in Preferences > API Providers
Best for: Long documents, detailed analysis, nuanced conversations
**Gemini 2.0 Flash**: Fast and efficient latest generation (1M context)
**Gemini 1.5 Pro**: Most capable previous generation (2M context!)
**Gemini 1.5 Flash**: Faster processing with excellent performance (1M context)
**Setup**: Add your Google AI API key in Preferences > API Providers
Best for: Massive context windows, processing huge documents or codebases
**Grok-2**: Latest reasoning-focused model (128k context)
**Grok Vision**: Multimodal capabilities for image understanding
**Setup**: Add your xAI API key in Preferences > API Providers
Best for: Real-time information, alternative perspectives, multimodal tasks
**Apple MLX**: Optimized for Apple Silicon, uses model.safetensors format
**Llama.cpp (GGUF)**: Efficient quantized models, cross-platform
**Models Location**: ~/Library/Caches/sam/models/ (auto-detected)
**Popular**: Qwen2.5 Coder, Qwen3, Llama 3, Phi-3, Mistral
**Setup**: Download models to models directory - SAM auto-detects them
Best for: Complete privacy, offline work, no API costs, Apple Silicon optimization
SAM supports Stable Diffusion models for AI image generation with two execution engines:
**CoreML**: Apple Silicon optimized, fast inference, lower memory usage
**Python**: Fallback using diffusers library, broader compatibility
Model Sources: HuggingFace (official models) and CivitAI (community models)

elements.content: You can switch models mid-conversation! Try different models for different parts of your workflow.
SAM is a powerful AI assistant with extensive capabilities across many domains.

properties.title: Local AI Inference
properties.description: Run AI models locally on your Mac with complete privacy

children.content: Use Qwen Coder for code generation without internet
Run Llama 3 locally for private conversations
Switch to local model for offline work

elements.content: Complete guide to creating AI-generated images with Stable Diffusion.

children.content: Install a Model: Go to Preferences > Image Generation > Model Browser
Download: Find a model you like and download it (with optional CoreML conversion)
Generate: Type your prompt in chat or ask the AI to generate an image
Generate an image of a serene mountain landscape at sunset
**Where to Find Models:**
**HuggingFace**: Official Stable Diffusion models and popular variants
**CivitAI**: 100,000+ community models with search, filtering, NSFW controls
**Model Types:**
**SD 1.5**: 512x512 images, fast, wide variety of fine-tuned models
**SD 2.x**: 768x768 images, improved quality
**SDXL**: 1024x1024 images, highest quality, slower
Start with SD 1.5 models - faster and more community options.
**CoreML (Recommended)**
Apple Silicon optimized (M1/M2/M3)
Fast inference (2-4 seconds per image)
Lower memory usage, energy efficient
**Python (Fallback)**
Uses diffusers library, broader model compatibility
Works with any .safetensors file
Slower but more flexible
SAM automatically chooses the best available engine based on what formats you have.
**Be Specific**: 'Serene mountain landscape at sunset' vs 'mountains'
**Add Style**: 'watercolor painting of...', 'photo-realistic...', 'digital art of...'
**Include Details**: Lighting, mood, composition, colors
**Use Quality Tags**: '8k', 'detailed', 'highly detailed', 'masterpiece'
A serene mountain landscape at sunset, golden hour lighting, 8k, detailed
Futuristic city with flying cars, neon lights, cyberpunk style, digital art
**Steps**: Number of diffusion steps (default: 20). More steps = higher quality, slower
**Guidance Scale**: How closely to follow prompt (default: 7.5). Higher = stricter
**Seed**: Random seed for reproducibility. Same seed + prompt = same image
**Size**: Image dimensions. Must match model's training (512x512 for SD 1.5, 1024x1024 for SDXL)
**Scheduler**: Sampling algorithm (DPM++, Euler, etc.). Different algorithms produce different results

elements.content: Organize, export, and manage your conversations effectively.

children.content: **New Conversation**: Click + button in sidebar or press Cmd+N
**Name Automatically**: First message becomes conversation name
**Rename Anytime**: Double-click conversation name to edit
**Fresh Start**: Each new conversation starts with clean context
**Model Selection**: Choose different AI models per conversation
**System Prompt**: Apply different personalities or behaviors
**Mini-Prompts**: Enable contextual information per conversation
**Tools Toggle**: Enable/disable tools independently
**Memory Scope**: Documents imported in one conversation don't affect others
Access settings via conversation header or right-click menu.
**Supported Formats:**
**PDF**: Professional document with formatting and metadata
**DOCX**: Microsoft Word document for editing
**Markdown**: Plain text with formatting for sharing
**JSON**: Complete conversation data for re-import
**How to Export:**
File menu > Export Conversation (Cmd+E)
Right-click conversation > Export
Choose format and save location
**Global Search**: Cmd+F to search across all conversations
**Filter by Folder**: Click folder to show only its conversations
**Recent Conversations**: Automatically sorted by last activity
**Find in Conversation**: Search within active chat
**Delete Conversation**: Right-click > Delete (Cmd+Backspace)
**Clear All History**: File > Clear History (removes all conversations)
Deletion is permanent unless you have backups. Export important conversations first.

Previous conversation

Export conversation
Delete conversation

elements.content: System prompts define SAM's personality and behavior. Choose the one that matches your task.
Autonomous AI partner with evidence-based problem-solving. Works independently, tests solutions, and provides proven results. Good for most tasks.

Relentless problem-solving with exhaustive execution. Extracts ALL data (not summaries), traces root causes, and works persistently until complete. Automatically enables Workflow Mode and Dynamic Iterations.
Development-focused with rigorous standards. Direct, technical, open-source oriented. Automatically enables Workflow Mode, Terminal Access, and Dynamic Iterations.
Ultra-simplified prompt for smaller local models. Removes complex instructions that confuse local models. Use this with downloaded models running on your Mac.

children.content: Use **Problem Solver** for thorough research and data work
Use **Developer** for coding projects
Use **Minimal** for local models
Stick with **Default** for everything else
Select from the **Prompt** dropdown in the chat toolbar
Or click **Parameters button** > System Prompt
Create custom prompts in **Preferences > System Prompts**
Go to Preferences > System Prompts
Click + to create a new prompt
Define personality, constraints, and behaviors
Save and select from the toolbar dropdown
Custom prompts let you create specialized assistants for specific workflows - coding standards, writing styles, analysis approaches, etc.

Formatted text for sharing

Imported documents are chunked and stored in conversation memory

elements.content: SAM has 14 integrated tools with 46+ operations. Here's a quick reference.

children.content: **read_file**: Read file contents
**write_file**: Create or update files
**list_directory**: List folder contents
**search_files**: Find files by name or content
**move_file**: Move or rename files
**delete_file**: Remove files (requires explicit path)
**import_document**: Import PDF, DOCX, TXT into memory
**create_pdf**: Generate PDF documents
**create_docx**: Generate Word documents
**create_xlsx**: Generate Excel spreadsheets
**analyze_document**: Extract and analyze document content
**web_search**: Search the web for information
**fetch_url**: Get content from a specific URL
**research**: Comprehensive multi-source research
**memory_search**: Search conversation memory
**memory_store**: Store information for later recall
**memory_list**: List stored memories
**execute_command**: Run shell commands
Real-time output streaming
Interactive terminal in SAM window
**generate_image**: Create images from text prompts
Supports Stable Diffusion 1.5, 2.x, SDXL
CoreML and Python execution engines
**list_events**: View calendar events
**create_event**: Add new calendar events
**find_free_time**: Find available time slots
**user_collaboration**: Ask for your confirmation
**panel**: Display formatted output panels
**task_planning**: Structured task management

elements.content: Toggle tools on/off with Cmd+T or the Tools button in toolbar. Tools are enabled by default but can be disabled for simple Q&A conversations.
Understanding the Model Context Protocol and how SAM's tools work.

children.content: MCP is a standardized way for AI assistants to interact with external tools and services.
**Tools**: Capabilities the AI can use (file operations, web search, etc.)
**Parameters**: Inputs required for each tool
**Execution**: AI decides when and how to use tools based on your request
**Responses**: Tool results are incorporated into AI's response
SAM's system prompt lists all available tools
AI analyzes your request and determines if tools are needed
AI selects appropriate tools and specifies parameters
SAM executes tools and returns results to AI
AI incorporates results into its response to you
**Intent Recognition**: AI understands what you want to accomplish
**Capability Matching**: Selects tools that can fulfill request
**Parameter Extraction**: Pulls required info from your message
**Chaining**: Combines multiple tools for complex tasks
**Error Handling**: Graceful recovery when tools fail
**Parameter Validation**: All inputs checked before execution
**Scope Limits**: Tools can't access arbitrary files or data
**No Wildcards**: Deletion requires explicit file paths
**Tools Toggle**: Disable ALL tools via toolbar (Cmd+T)
**API Direct Mode**: Zero tool access for pure chat
**Transparency**: Tool usage visible in conversation
AI can chain multiple tools for complex tasks:
Research Python async/await, summarize findings, and save to a file
Step 1: web_operations - Search for documentation
Step 2: fetch_page - Get content from top results
Step 3: Analysis - Extract key concepts
Step 4: file_operations - Save summary to file

elements.content: Get better results with effective prompting techniques.

children.content: Vague requests get vague results. Be explicit about what you want.
BAD: Write me some code
GOOD: Write a Python function that reads a CSV file and returns the top 10 rows by the 'sales' column
Help SAM understand your situation and constraints.
What's your goal? What problem are you solving?
What have you tried? What didn't work?
What constraints exist? (language, framework, style)
I'm building a SwiftUI app and need a view that displays user profiles. Each profile should show name, avatar, and bio. The design should match Apple HIG.
Tell SAM how you want the result formatted.
List the top 5 Python frameworks with pros and cons in a table format
Explain recursion using a simple analogy suitable for beginners
Give me step-by-step instructions I can follow to set up Docker
Build on responses to get exactly what you need.
Ask for modifications: 'Make it shorter' or 'Add error handling'
Request alternatives: 'Show me another approach'
Drill down: 'Explain the second step in more detail'
Combine: 'Now merge both approaches into one solution'
I have a list of customer emails. Write a Python script to validate email format, remove duplicates, and export to a new CSV.
Review this Swift code for performance issues. Focus on memory management and async patterns. Suggest specific improvements.
Research the best practices for REST API versioning. Compare 3 approaches and recommend one for a startup building a public API.

elements.content: The more context and specificity you provide, the better SAM's responses will be. Don't be afraid to write longer prompts!
Tips for getting the best performance from SAM on your Mac.

children.content: **Fastest**: GPT-3.5 Turbo, Gemini Flash, local MLX models
**Balanced**: GPT-4 Turbo, Claude 3.5 Sonnet
**Thorough**: O1/O3 reasoning models (slower but deeper analysis)
Use faster models for quick questions, thorough models for complex analysis.
**MLX** models are optimized for Apple Silicon - prefer these
**GGUF** quantized models trade quality for speed
**Q4_K_M** quantization is good balance of speed/quality
**Smaller models** (7B-13B) respond faster than large (70B+)
**Unified Memory** - more RAM = larger models, more context
**CoreML** is 2-4x faster than Python on Apple Silicon
**SD 1.5** generates faster than SDXL (smaller images)
**Fewer steps** = faster generation (20 steps usually sufficient)
**Keep model loaded** - first generation is slower
**Close unused conversations** to free memory
**Clear conversation history** periodically
**Use cloud AI** for memory-intensive tasks
**Restart SAM** if performance degrades after long sessions
**Disable tools** (Cmd+T) for simple Q&A - fewer tokens processed
**Shorter context** - long conversations slow down responses
**Start fresh** - new conversation for unrelated topics
**Check Activity Monitor** - SAM should use GPU for local inference

elements.content: Solutions to common issues and questions.

Check these items:
- Verify your API key is configured in Preferences (Cmd+,)
- Check your internet connection for cloud AI providers
- Restart SAM and try again
- Check the Console app for SAM error messages

properties.question: SAM isn't responding to my messages

elements.content:
Possible causes:
- File path incorrect (use file:// prefix)
- File format not supported
- File corrupted or password-protected
- Insufficient disk space

Try: Verify file opens in its native application first

Ensure:
- Output directory has write permissions
- Filename doesn't contain invalid characters
- Sufficient disk space available
- No existing file is locked in another app

Check:
- Internet connection is active
- Search API keys configured in Preferences
- Query is specific enough
- Try rephrasing your research question

Remember:
- Documents must be imported first
- Memory is conversation-scoped by default
- Use similarity_threshold=0.3 for broader results
- Try different query phrasings

properties.question: Memory search doesn't find my documents

elements.content:
Optimize performance:
- Close unused conversations
- Clear conversation history periodically
- Use cloud AI instead of local models for resource-intensive tasks
- Restart SAM to clear cached data

properties.question: SAM is using too much memory/CPU

elements.content:
Check these items:
- Verify model is in correct directory: ~/Library/Caches/sam/models/provider/model/
- Restart SAM to rescan for new models
- Check SAM User Guide for installation instructions

properties.question: Local model not appearing in dropdown

children.content:
Check these items:
- Verify model directory contains .mlmodelc files (CoreML) or .safetensors
- Check Preferences > Local Models to see detected models
- Restart SAM to rescan models

Troubleshoot conversion issues:
- Check logs for specific error messages
- Ensure sufficient disk space (~5-10GB per model)
- Try downloading SafeTensors only
- Check model compatibility (SD 1.x, 2.x, SDXL supported)

This is normal behavior:
- Model only has one format available
- CoreML-only: Download SafeTensors to enable Python option
- SafeTensors-only: Convert to CoreML to enable CoreML option

elements.content: How SAM protects your data and respects your privacy.

children.content: **Conversation History**: Stored locally in ~/Library/Application Support/sam/
**Vector Database**: Encrypted SQLite database for memory search
**Imported Documents**: Chunked and stored in local database
**Temporary Files**: Automatically cleaned up after operations

elements.content: When using remote API providers, your conversation data (messages, prompts, and context) is sent to third-party servers for processing. Choose local models if privacy is a concern.

children.content: Data sent to provider's servers for processing
Your messages and conversation context visible to third party
Subject to provider's privacy policy and terms of service
Faster processing, more powerful models
Requires internet connection and API keys
All processing happens on your Mac
No data sent to external servers - complete privacy
Works offline without internet connection
Complete conversation privacy - nothing leaves your device
Optimized for Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3 chips)
**API Keys**: Store in Preferences, never share in conversations
**Sensitive Data**: Use local models or API Direct mode
**Exported Files**: Secure exported conversations (may contain sensitive info)
**Updates**: Keep SAM updated for latest security fixes
**Clear History**: File > Clear History (removes all conversations)
**Delete Specific Conversation**: Conversation > Delete Conversation
**Complete Removal**: Delete ~/Library/Application Support/sam/
